title: Nursyahida Rashid, Celine Deans, Siti Awg, and Siti Nurmaisara. (2024)

transcript.text: Excuse me. I'll give you 50 ringgit if
you know what is the Malaysian's
national animal. H is it the Malayan
tiger?
>> Correct. Here's your 50 ringit.
[Music]
The Malayan tiger only found in
Peninsula Malaysia and southern Thailand
is critically endangered and holds a
deep cultural significance.
Known as Harima and Papalang, which
means uncle stripes, it was officially
recognized as a distinct subspecies in
2004. In Malay folklore, tigers are
symbols of strength and guardianship
representing the wildlands that was
dominated.
Now, why is Malayan tiger considered as
an endangered animal? Well, let me show
you.
This line graph illustrates the
population trend of Malayan tigers in
the 1950s to the present. According to
this study, Malaysia was estimated to
have as many as 3,000 tigers in the
1950s. However, the population size
dropped significantly in 1982 and seems
to be declining with only 200 Malayan
tigers left today. Hence, this
information alone serve as enough
evidence for us to protect this
endangered animal.
Let's talk about the causes of
endangerment.
The first and perhaps most significant
threat to the Malayan tigers is poching.
They are being hunted and poached for
their body parts which are highly
valuable in illegal wildlife markets.
Another threat to the Malayan tigers is
habitat loss which is caused by
deforestation.
Finally, the battle to save the Malayan
tiger is hindered by a lack of awareness
and inconsistent law enforcement. While
laws exist to protect these tigers, they
are often poorly enforced and without
widespread awareness, many people don't
understand the critical situation tigers
face or how their actions contribute to
it. Now that we've covered on the
urgency of the situation, let's talk
about who can make a real change. Our
petition today is more than just to
spread awareness. It is about pushing
for a crucial initiative in establishing
a sperm bank in Malaysia.
>> But what exactly is a sperm bank?
>> A sperm bank collects and freezes sperm
for future use, ensuring species can
reproduce even if their numbers decline.
For endangered species like the Malayan
tiger, it helps preserve genetic
diversity and supports conservation
efforts.
Therefore, the government plays a
crucial role in this fight. But your
voice matters more. Come and sign our
petition to help us build Malaysia's
first sperm bank for the Malayan tigers.
[Music]
